translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽. The Section with Similes
The Elder Pañcadīpaka
“I had faith in the true Teaching🔽of Padumuttara, the Buddha,
who had compassion for all beings.🔽I had a correct view.
I offered a lamp
and surrounded the Bodhi tree.
Having faith in the lamps,
I did this for a while.

analyzed: yam yam yonupapajjāmi  devattam atha mānusa
translated: Whatever womb I entered,🔽whether divine or human,
they held a lamp in the sky;
this is the fruit of giving a lamp.
Through walls and through mountains,
having gone beyond,
I saw a hundred leagues all around.
By the remainder of that deed,🔽I attained the destruction of the pollutants.
I bear this last body
in the dispensation of the Lord of the Dhamma.
For forty-four centuries,
kings named Satacakkhu
were very powerful,
universal monarchs.
The four analytical knowledges …
… the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā pañcadīpako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā pañcadīpakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus the elder Pañcadīpaka recited these verses.
The Story of the Elder Pañcadīpaka is the seventh.
